message: For others that find this later, the full response: add "staticfiles.finders.LegacyAppDirectoriesFinder" to STATICFILES_FINDERS for the previous default behaviour "media"
Fork the apps and rename their static media directory? :P
so either fork them, or live with 0.3
@jezdez wins on IRC, LegacyAppDirectoriesFinder already does this

I am starting a new project on Django 1.2.5 and as usual one of the first things I installed was staticfiles. I figured I would stick with the 1.0 series so that it will be a relatively painless conversion to Django 1.3, but I can't figure out how to make it work with apps the haven't moved to the new static/ layout (as opposed to media/). STATICFILES_MEDIA_DIRNAMES used to be a backup to allow this, but this setting has been purged from what I can tell. Is this really lose/lose? Am I stuck on staticfiles 0.3 (which makes the 1.3 switch more annoying) until every single app I use moves to the new layout? This hardly seems like a smooth migration.
I get what you're saying, but you're going to be stuck on Django 1.2 until those apps are updated anyway

The other option is to make a custom finder, which I could keep in my app for now but this hardly seems like a good idea since that interface is specifically stated to be internal (and @jezdez yelled at me when I suggested it on https://bitbucket.org/izi/django-admin-tools/issue/66/rename-the-media-folder-to-static).
FTR, I hope apps move to the "static" name swiftly
it's funny you say I win on IRC, guess convore hasn't replaced it for me (yet)
